dct_title_s: Nulla dies abeat, quin linea ducta supersit
dct_description_sm: Title within banner at map top.

North polar projection with California as an island with rounded northern coastline. Shading shows day and night on the earth, with the sun pictured at bottom left and the moon at bottom right, and roman numerals (I-XII twice) surrounding the map.

Also included on title page of his Grosser Atlas, 1731, and as center part of a clock on sheet with geographical text entitled “Geographische universal-zeig und schlag-uhr”, with added mountains in America.
